application.ref: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

affiliation.orgName: Computer Science Department Brandeis University Waltham
Computer Science Department Brandeis University Waltham

abstract.p: Although TD-Gammon is one of the major successes in machine learning , it has not led to similar impressive breakthroughs in temporal difference learning for other applications or even other games. We were able to replicate some of the success of TD-Gammon, developing a competitive evaluation function on a 4000 parameter feed-forward neu-ral network, without using back-propagation, reinforcement or temporal difference learning methods. Instead we apply simple hill-climbing in a relative fitness environment. These results and further analysis suggest that the surprising success of Tesauro's program had more to do with the co-evolutionary structure of the learning task and the dynamics of the backgammon game itself.
